column4: hlm - looks like you need to add some repository for nonfree stuff
that sounds bad. Did it say something like "i repair this and that" a million times?
I'm running it from gparted
hmm. I would wipe the drive and do a fresh format, then a surface scan.
24hrs is too long
It has all of my backups on it - ones that I need to restore, I'm getting a "stale NFS file handle (116)" error when I try to copy data
thats beyon my knowledge... you could try EasyRecovery, the demo is fully funcional for some days and *might* be able to read from your linux partition, too.
google that error message
alright, I'll give that a shot.  thanks.  Also, I did google it, it said to fsck on it.
this is my dmesg, notice the problems at the bottom: http://pastebin.com/d10511920
Buffer I/O Error most often is a very bad sign. Your drive might already be lost, but lets hope, that you get your data.
I'll grab EasyRecovery and see what that does.  Thanks.
Buffer I/O errors point to damaged drive electronics
yes.  excellent.
I'ma give ddrescue a shot and see what I can do with that
keep me posted on the results. Good luck!
wait, this is going to make a 500gb iso img, isn't it.
uhm. yes.
crap.  I don't have the space on my laptop for that.
well, photorec recovered them all, just didn't save them into their directories
so I don't know...if that was even useful.
things that need to be freed is handled by the kernel
